Definition: A malignant tumor originating from breast tissue.
A malignant tumor that originates in the tissues of the lung.
A regulated cellular process leading to controlled cell death.
The physiological process through which new blood vessels form from pre-existing vessels.

Synonyms: p53 tumor suppressor; cellular tumor antigen p53
Definition: A gene encoding a protein that regulates the cell cycle and prevents genomic mutations.
A class of drugs that block PARP enzymes and are used in cancer treatment to exploit DNA repair weaknesses.
A measurable substance used as an indicator of a biological condition or disease.
